Content.Text:
Tool to clear grass, dead
crops, and harvest crops.
Made of stone. Upgrade it
to clear a wider area.

Tool to clear grass, dead
crops, and harvest crops.
Made of copper. Upgrade it
to clear a wider area.

Tool to clear grass, dead
crops, and harvest crops.
Made of silver. Upgrade it
to clear a wider area.

Tool to clear grass, dead
crops, and harvest crops.
Made of gold. Upgrade it
to clear a wider area.

Tool to clear grass, dead
crops, and harvest crops.
Made of diamond. Cannot
upgrade further.

Tool to till the soil.
Made of stone. Heavy and
hard to swing. Upgrade it
to hoe a wider area.

Tool to till the soil.
Made of copper. Upgrade it
to hoe a wider area.

Tool to till the soil.
Made of silver. Upgrade it
to hoe a wider area.

Tool to till the soil.
Made of gold. Upgrade it
to hoe a wider area.

Tool to till the soil.
Made of diamond. Ultimate
hoe. Can till a whole
field with one swing.

Tool to water crops.
Doesn't hold much water.
Upgrade it to hold more.

Tool to water crops. Made
of copper. Upgrade it to
hold more water.

Tool to water crops. Made
of silver. Upgrade it to
hold more water.

Tool to water crops. Made
of gold. Upgrade it to
hold more water.

A mysterious watering can
that loses hardly any
water when you use it.

Can chop fruit trees,
broadleaf trees, and small
branches to small lumber.
Upgrade to chop better.

Can chop fruit trees,
evergreen trees, and
branches into lumber.
Upgrade it to chop better.

Can chop black branches
into black lumber. There
is nothing this axe
cannot chop.

Can turn small rocks into
small material stone.
Upgrade it to smash
rocks.

Turn rocks into material
stone. Gets minerals in
the mine. Upgrade it to
smash black rocks.

Can turn black rocks into
black material stone. Gets
minerals in the mine. The
ultimate hammer.

Equip it and you can get
milk from cows and yaks.
Upgrade it to milk faster.

Equip it and you can get
milk from cows and yaks.
Your cows will love this
model!

Equip it to clip wool from
your sheep, alpacas and
llamas. Your animals will
be tidily trimmed too!

Equip it to clip wool from
your sheep, alpacas and
llamas. Works faster than
regular clippers.

Equip it and use it on
your animals to clean
them...except chickens!
Upgrade to brush faster.

Equip it and use it on
your animals to clean
them...except chickens!
Makes their coats shine!

Ordinary fishing rod.
Use it to catch fish at a
fishing spot. What fish
will bite?

Stronger than a regular
fishing rod. You can catch
big fish with this!

Equip it and use it to
call your animals. Handy
when you graze them.

Equip and use it to get
info on your animals'
condition. It shows their
names and what they need.

Use it to clean out the
barn of food scraps and
other waste. It's sharp,
so be careful!

Drill to make holes in
ice. But the river doesn't
freeze around here...

Medicine to treat sick 
animals. Equip it, stand
by a sick animal and press
the A Button to use it.

Spread it to raise the
quality of your crops.
Can apply it once per day.
Works on mushrooms too.

Leash for walking dogs and
cats. With this, you can
walk without worries!

Bait that attracts a lot
of different fish. Scatter
it, and the fish will
come.

A popular high-quality
bait. Scatter it, and
lots of fish will come.

Fantastic bait to use when
fishing for big-game fish.
It's effective!

Great bait to use for
catching elusive premium
fish. It's really
effective!

A machine inspired by the
dream of flight. Built
according to the blueprint
but...how does it move?

Crop that grows well in
spring. Harvest it 4 to 5
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
spring. Harvest it 5 to 7
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
spring. Harvest it 10 to
14 days after sowing. You
can only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
spring. Harvest it 8 to 11
days after sowing and then
every 3 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
spring. Harvest 12 to 17
days after sowing and then
every 4 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
summer. Harvest it 5 to 7
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
summer. Harvest it 10 to
14 days after sowing. You
can only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
summer. Harvest it 9 to 13
days after sowing and then
every 3 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
summer. Harvest 10 to 15
days after sowing and then
every 4 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
summer. Harvest 12 to 17
days after sowing and then
every 4 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
summer. Harvest 13 to 20
days after sowing and then
every 4 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
fall. Harvest it 4 to 5
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
fall. Harvest it 5 to 7
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
fall. Harvest it 9 to 13
days after sowing and then
every 3 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
fall. Harvest it 5 to 6
days after sowing and then
every 2 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
fall. Harvest it 9 to 13
days after sowing and then
every 3 days afterward.

Crop that grows well in
winter. Harvest it 4 to 5
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
winter. Harvest it 9 to 13
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Crop that grows well in
winter. Harvest it 8 to 11
days after sowing and then
every 4 days afterward.

Flower that grows well in
spring. Harvest it 7 to 10
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Flower that grows well in
spring. Harvest it 5 to 7
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Flower that grows well in
spring. Harvest it 9 to 13
days after sowing. You can

summer. Harvest 10 to 14
days after sowing. You can

summer. Harvest it 7 to 10

summer. Harvest it 7 to 10

fall. Harvest it 5 to 7

fall. Harvest it 9 to 13

winter. Harvest it 7 to 10

Flower that grows well in
winter. Harvest it 5 to 7
days after sowing. You can

Flower that grows well in
winter. Harvest 14 to 20
days after sowing. You can
only harvest it once.

Grows well in all seasons.
Harvest it 9 to 13 days
after sowing. Can only
harvest it once.

Paddy crop that you sow in
spring and harvest in
fall. Can only harvest
once, with a sickle.

Crop that grows in any
season. Can harvest only
once about 1 month after
sowing. Cut with a sickle.

Grows in any season.
Harvest about 1 1/2 months
after sowing, with sickle.
Can only harvest it once.

Paddy crop that grows in
any season. Harvest about
15 days after sowing, with
a sickle.

Paddy crop that grows in
any season. Harvest about
20 days after sowing, with
a sickle.

Tree that bears fruit in
spring for about 2 months.
Bears fruit again every
3 days after you harvest.

Tree that bears fruit in
summer for about 1 1/2
months. Bears fruit again
every 3 days.

Tree that bears fruit in
summer for about 2 months.
Bears fruit again every
4 days after you harvest.

Tree that bears fruit in
summer for about 2 months.
Bears fruit again every
3 days after you harvest.

Tree that bears fruit in
fall for about 1 1/2
months. Bears fruit again
every 3 days.

Tree that bears fruit in
fall for about 2 months.
Bears fruit again every
3 days after you harvest.

Tree that bears fruit in
fall for about 2 months.
Bears fruit again every
4 days after you harvest.

Tree that bears fruit in
fall for about 1 1/2
months. Bears fruit again
every 3 days.

Tree that bears fruit in
winter for about 2 months.
Bears fruit again every
3 days after you harvest.

Tree that bears tea leaves
every 5 days in spring,
summer, and fall for about
1 month.

Crop that grows in all
seasons. Used as material
for clothes. Harvest after
about 8 days, with sickle.

Crop that grows in all
seasons. Used as material
for clothes. Harvest after
about 10 days with sickle.

Herb that grows in any
season. Can harvest 8-12
days after sowing, and
every 4 days afterward.

for farm animals. Can
harvest with sickle 2 days

Makes tea that is

Makes tea that is
delicious in recipes.

fall.
Makes tea that is
delicious in recipes.

Harvested fiber crop.
A yellowish-brown color.
Can be used in making
clothes.

Harvested fiber crop.
A pure white color.
Can be used in making
clothes.

Fodder for cows, sheep,
etc. You can place up to
10 portions in a feed box.

A type of mushroom that
sprouts from time to time.
Wonderful aroma and very
popular.

A type of mushroom that
sprouts from time to time.
A big cluster of small
mushrooms. Use in cooking.

A type of mushroom that
sprouts in the fall.
Big, fat and chewy.
People love it.

A type of mushroom that
sprouts from time to time.
Shaped like tree or coral
branches.

A type of mushroom that
sprouts from time to time.
Round and white. Great-
tasting and very popular.

A poisonous mushroom.
Will make you sick for
sure! Takes a brave (or
foolish) person to eat...

Delicious milk!
Use in cooking or making
cheese.

Amazingly delicious milk!
Use in cooking or making
cheese.

Rich and delicious milk!
Use in cooking or making
cheese.

Extremely rich and
delicious milk!
Use in cooking or making
cheese.

Milk from yaks.
The flavor is not so rich,
but distinctive. Use in
cooking or making cheese.

Milk from yaks.
Very nutritious and strong
in flavor. Use in cooking
or making cheese.

Soft sheep's wool. More
valuable when made into a
yarn ball. Can be used to
make clothing, etc.

The finest soft, luxurious
sheep's wool. More
valuable as a yarn ball.
Used to make clothes, etc.

Wool from Suffolk sheep.
More valuable when made
into a yarn ball. Used to
make clothing, etc.

The finest soft, luxurious
wool from Suffolk sheep.
More valuable as yarn.
Used to make clothes, etc.

White wool from alpacas.
More prized than sheep's
wool. Fuzzy to the touch.

The finest white wool from
alpacas. More prized than
sheep's wool. Fuzzy to the
touch.

Brown wool from brown
alpacas, more prized than
sheep's wool. Fuzzy to the
touch.

The finest brown wool from
brown alpacas, more prized
than sheep's wool. Fuzzy
to the touch.

Wool from llamas, far more
prized than sheep's wool.
Fluffy to the touch.

The finest wool from
llamas, far more prized
than sheep's wool.
Fluffy to the touch.

A delicious egg.
Ingredient in recipes.
Put in the incubator
to hatch a chick.

A delicious silkie egg.
Ingredient in recipes.
Put in the incubator
to hatch a chick.

Amazingly delicious egg.
Ingredient in recipes.
Put in the incubator to
hatch a chick.

Supremely delicious silkie
egg. Ingredient in
recipes. put in incubator
to hatch a chick.

Honey from a beehive.
Very sweet and delicious.

Honey with a floral taste.
The scent of flowers and
the sweetness of honey are
a perfect match.

The ultimate jelly, very
rare and hard to acquire.
One taste of it and you're
bursting with energy.

Salad made with turnip.
People love the crunchy
texture.

Salad of mashed potatoes.
Surprisingly filling.

Dish of cucumbers in oil.
Goes perfectly with rice.

Salad with sliced onions.
A little bit bitter.

Salad with pumpkin.
The chewy skin and sweet
flesh are perfectly
balanced.

Salad with sliced
tomatoes.
Irresistible zesty flavor.

Salad with corn.
Popular with kids who
don't like vegetables.

Spinach dish with a
delicate flavor.

Salad showcasing the
sweetness of yam.
Like eating dessert!

Salad with julienned or
sliced daikon.
Dig in to that crisp,
firm texture!

Egg yolks in this dish
look like mimosa flowers,
giving it its name.

Milk over fresh vegetables
makes this salad.
It's a bit high-calorie.

Salad of mixed herbs.
Wonderful aroma that
whets your appetite.

Raw veggies and mushrooms
make up this salad.
Varies in taste based on
which mushrooms you add.

Carpaccio of the elusive
huchen fish. Has a herbal
aroma.

Zesty kimchi is popular
with kids and old folks.

A salad of various mixed
vegetables.

A salad of potato with
pickled plums.
The sweetness of potato
and sourness of plum!

Potato and cod roe dressed
in mayonnaise make a
hearty salad!

Very healthy salad made
with boiled soybeans.

Julienned cabbage and
onions wrapped in rice
paper make this salad.

Salad of cucumber
garnished with pickled
plum. Perfect for beating
the summer heat.

Pasta in salad form!
Light and zesty.

Herbal flavor with a touch
of honey's sweetness in
this salad of summer
vegetables.

Root vegetable fritters
garnished with cabbage.
This salad is a meal in
itself!

Julienned veggies plus
apples dressed in honey,
yogurt, and mayonnaise.
A sumptuous salad.

A salad of fresh summer
vegetables.
Enjoy the pure flavor of
the ingredients.

A simple combination of
tomato and cheese.

The sweetness of yam meets
the kick of curry in this
salad that balances sweet
and spicy just right.

Salad of mushroom
marinated with pickled
plum. Has a delicate,
gourmet taste.

Soup made by simmering
turnips slowly. A melt in
your mouth turnipy taste
sensation.

Onion soup. When made
into soup, the onions
lose their bitterness.

A soup made by pureeing
simmered potatoes and
adding cream.

Soup of simmered tomatoes
with a smooth, tangy
flavor.

Corn soup.
Adults and kids both love
it.

Potage soup made with
spinach paste and cream.

Boiled carrots pureed with
cream added to make a
soup.

Soup with beaten egg.
Highlights the rich flavor
of egg.

Pureed boiled vegetables
with milk added to make a
nutritious soup.

Melted cheese soup.
Rich, smooth flavor.

Soup of herbs.
Even just smelling it is
delightful!

Cream soup with plenty of
mushrooms.

Dish of tomato and other
veggies simmered with fish
and other ingredients.

Delicately flavored soup
with noodles in it.
Soup with pasta in it!

A cold potato soup.
Very refreshing in the
heat of summer.

Broth extracted by
simmering down vegetables.
Base for many kinds of
soup.

Soup made with fish.
Delicious when served
chilled during the summer.

A variety of vegetables
simmered down to make a
hearty soup.
Belly-warming.

A cold tomato soup,
perfect when you want
something zesty.

A tomato-flavored soup
packed with vegetables.

Spinach and beaten egg
make a delicate, clear
soup.

Soup made with soybeans.
Not sweet. In certain
places, people eat this
all the time.

A spicy soup made by
simmering fish and
vegetables in a special
roux.

Pulpy soup made from
grated lotus root.

Soybeans are crushed and
soaked in water then
heated to make this
smooth-tasting beverage.

A fairly rich soup made by
mixing yogurt and flour.

Soup made with clams.
The clam juice and basil
flavors are a perfect
match.

Tangy and spicy, this soup
will make you sweat!

Delicate soup made from
fish stock. A typical
soup, along with miso
soup, of a certain land.

Chowder made with fish.
Using clams instead of
fish makes it clam
chowder.

Gourmet soup containing
lots of sturgeon's fin.

Indulgent gourmet soup
with mitten crab and
sturgeon.

Thinly sliced potato,
grilled golden brown.

Thinly sliced pumpkin,
grilled with teriyaki
sauce.

Tomato sliced in rounds
and grilled.
This way of cooking makes
them sweet and delicious!

Simple and delicious
roasted corn on the cob.

Sauteed spinach. Simple
and full of nutritional
value.

It's just yam, roasted,
but people can't get
enough of it!

Stir-fried vegetables.
The more ingredients, the
better it tastes!

The easiest thing you can
cook! Fry it up and eat
it!

Oven roasted cheese,
bubbling with gooey
goodness.

Roasted mushrooms with
a savory aroma that whets
the appetite.

Just grilled fish.
A simple way to appreciate
the taste of the fish.

Turnips sauteed in butter.
Using fragrant butter is
the key.

Stir-fried vegetables in a
slightly gelatinized soup.

Vegetables set in bouillon
and gelatin. Looks lovely.
Served chilled as an
appetizer.

Flour batter with cabbage

compete with the summer
sunshine!

A bouquet of fall
flowers. Muted colors that
give a sense of quiet and
peace.

A bouquet of winter
flowers. The simple range
of colors has an austere
elegance.

Eastern-style bouquet.
Avoids flashy colors but
has deep, quiet beauty.

Bouquet of sunflowers.
Look great under a blue
sky.

A bouquet of four kinds of
roses. This passionate
bunch of roses shows
passionate feelings.

A bouquet of various
flowers. You can make
whatever selection you
want. Be creative!

A fragment of coral from
the Southern Island.
Makes a great memento.

A precious gem that comes
from a shellfish. Has a
beautiful glossy luster.
Called "mermaid's tears."

Sea urchin that comes from
distant islands. A marine
delicacy not found here.
Summer ones taste best.

A rather rare fossil of a
fish. Might sell at a good
price to collectors.

A small bottle carried by
the current from who knows
where, with a letter
inside from who knows who.

An empty can somebody
threw away. Something is
written on the label...
but you can't read it.
A fish skeleton.

A boot somebody lost
somewhere while they were
fishing. Now it's full of
holes.

A nice treat to give to
children.

The local dirt.
Useful in making roads and
flowerpots and other
things.

Rock containing various
minerals. Looks like it
provides material for
making things.

Valuable mineral that
sells at a high price.
Makes you feel high-class
just having it!

Valuable mineral that
sells at a high price.
Makes you feel rich just
having it!

Mineral with an affordable
price, often found in the
mine.

Low-priced mineral.
Has no real use, but
sometimes people want the
stuff for some reason.

Chunk of brick.
Dusty red color and rough
texture. Often used as a
building material.

Chunk of glass.
White and smooth.
Often used as a
building material.

Mineral with an affordable
price, often found in the
mine. In some places, it's
known as "black gold".

Valuable mineral that
sells at a high price.
Transparent and beautiful.
Used in fortune-telling.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
Glittering red mineral.
Rarely found.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
Popular since ancient
times. Very precious.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
Very hard and beautiful.
A girl's best friend.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
Dazzlingly beautiful. A
mineral worth digging for.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
Green mineral prized
throughout history.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
A transformed mineral.
Rarely found.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
A bright green mineral.
One you never tire to see!

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
A flower-shaped mineral.
One of nature's miracles.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
Mineral that glows like a
firefly. One to treasure!

Gem with mysterious power.
Extremely hard.
Sells for a high price.

Mineral with mysterious
power. A legend among
legendary minerals. Its
true nature is unknown.

Mineral with mysterious
power. An enigmatic
substance.
Sells for a high price.

Precious metal that sells
at a high price. Will
never tarnish or degrade,
so it is very costly.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
More precious than diamond
and a natural masterpiece.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price. A truly
"charming" gem long used
as a protective charm.

Valuable gem that sells at
a high price.
Shimmers like moonlight.
Occasionally found.

A stone hidden away by a
sage. Its purpose is
unknown. Emanates a
mysterious force.

Weeds that grow along the
roadside. You should be as
persistent in life as they
are!

A small rock. Smash with
a hammer to make small
material stone and get
a higher price.

A rock. Smash with an
iron hammer to make
material stone and
get a higher price.

A rare rock. Smash with
an ultra hammer to
make black material stone
and get a higher price.

A small branch lying along
the road. Chop with axe to
make small lumber and sell
for a higher price.

A branch lying along the
road. Chop with an iron
axe to make lumber and get
a higher price.

A rare branch. Chop with
an ultra axe to make
black lumber and get a
higher price.

A branch with pine needles
on it. They're a little
sharp and can prick you...
Used in some blueprints.

A branch with vivid cherry
blossoms on it from the
Land of the East.
Used in some blueprints.

A branch with gingko
leaves on it. Absolutely
perfect foliage color.
Used in some blueprints.

A yellow wildflower.
Lovely fragrance.

A blue wildflower.
Lovely fragrance.

A red wildflower.
Lovely fragrance.

A rare wild plant.
Believed to have medicinal
properties.

Tree nut that sometimes
falls to the ground. Very
hard shell. Used in
recipes for treats, etc.

Tree nut that falls to the
ground in fall. Used in
many recipes. Careful with
the spiny shell.

Fruit that falls in fall.
Used in recipes for
treats, etc.

Fruit that falls in
summer.
Used in beverages and
recipes.

Fruit that falls in
summer.
Used in beverages and
recipes.

Sprouts up in spring.
Used in various recipes.

A tough plant that grows
up from bamboo shoots.
Bamboo leaves are what
pandas eat.

A part of the hive where
bees live. Full of holes,
and the holes are full of
honey.

Did someone make this
snowball or is it natural?
Throw it to break it and
you might find something.

Made by hitting small rock
with a hammer, and sells
for a little more than
small rock does.

Made by hitting rock
with an iron hammer.
Sells for a little
more than rock does.

Made by hitting black
rock with an ultra hammer.
Sells for a little more
than black rock.

Made by chopping small
branches with an axe.
Sells for a little more
than small branches.

Made by chopping branches
with an iron axe. Sells
for a little more than
branches do.

Made by chopping black
branches with an ultra
axe. Sells for a little
more than black branches.

Totally ordinary coin.
Some people collect them.
Seems like it might be
useful for something.

Slightly tarnished coin.
Worth more than a regular
coin? Seems like it might
be useful for something.

Shiny coin. Coveted by
collectors. Seems like it
might be useful for
something.

Grows on tropical trees.
Inside there is a liquid
with an unusual taste.

A mysterious figure made
by no one knows who.
What does it represent?

Natural ice. Strangely
enough it doesn't melt as
you carry it. Needed for
recipes like ice cream!

A shell in the shape of a
fish skeleton, sometimes
found in warm regions.

An empty shell sometimes
found in warm regions.
Could be used as a
musical instrument.

Red feathers dropped by a
wild animal.
Fluffy like cotton.

Green feathers dropped by
a wild animal. Fluffy
like cotton.

Blue feathers dropped by a
wild animal.
Fluffy like cotton.

Yellow feathers dropped by
a wild animal.
Fluffy like cotton.

Orange feathers dropped by
a wild animal.
Fluffy like cotton.

Purple feathers dropped by
a wild animal.
Fluffy like cotton.

Fish you can only catch in
the sea. Looks almost
identical to eel.

Fish you can catch in
various places. Has a
wonderful aroma suggesting
watermelon or cucumber.

Fish you can catch
anywhere. Can catch in a
fish trap. A small but
nice sweetfish.

Fish you can only catch
in the sea. People in
many parts of the world
love to eat this fish!

Fish you can catch in
rivers or waterfalls.
Likes cold water.

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in
a fish trap. Small but
splendid char.

Fish you can catch in
rivers or waterfalls.

Fish you can catch in the
sea or rivers.
Has a big mouth full of
sharp teeth.

Fish you can catch in
various places.

Fish you often catch in
rivers.

Fish you can only catch
in the sea.

Fish that lives in the
depths.

Fish you can only catch
in the sea.

Fish you can catch in
various places. Has
two whiskers.

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Small but
splendid carp.

Fish you can catch in
various places. Grows up

Fish you can only catch
in the sea. Shimmering
blue scales.

Fish you can catch in
rivers and cold places.

Fish you can only catch
in the sea.

Fish you can catch in
various places. Named
after the leaves of a

Fish you can catch
anywhere. Small but
splendid shishamo.

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a

Fish you often catch in
rivers or the sea.

Fish you can catch in
various places. Called by

Fish you can only catch in
cold places. Huge and
splendid sea bass!

Fish you can only catch
in the sea.

Fish you can catch in
rivers.

Fish you often catch along
the shore by your farm.
Has ten whiskers!

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Small but

Fish you often catch along
the shore by your farm.
Huge and splendid loach!

Fish you can only catch
in the sea.

Fish you often catch in

Fish you can catch in
rivers.
Swims by flapping its
pectoral fins.

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Small but

Fish you can only catch
in the sea. Both eyes are
on the left side of its
head!

Fish you can only catch
in the sea. Watch out
for the poisonous part!

Fish you can catch in
various places. Eats all
kinds of things.

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Small but
splendid funa.

Fish you can catch in
various places. Huge
and splendid funa!

Fish you can catch in
various places. Strong
for its size!

Fish you can catch in
various places. Has a blue
pattern around its gills.

Fish you can catch in
various places.

Fish you can only catch in
the sea.

Fish you can catch in
various places. A little
bit different from salmon.

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Small but
splendid trout.

Fish you can only catch
in the sea. Huge and
splendid trout!

Fish you often catch in
the sea. Known for its
easygoing facial
expression.

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Lives in
clear water.

Fish you can catch in
rivers or waterfalls.
Has a graceful beauty.

Fish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Small but
splendid trout.

Fish you can catch in
various places.

Fish you can catch in
various places. Huge
and splendid snakehead!

Fish you often catch in
rivers. This is the fish
to catch in winter!
Delicious as tempura!

Marine animal you often
catch in the sea. No bones
and soft flesh. Careful or
they'll squirt ink on you!

Marine animal you can only
catch in the sea. No bones
and soft flesh. If its
suckers grab you it hurts!

Crab you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Only found in
clean, clear rivers.

Crab you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap. Love that
blue color!

Crustacean you can only
catch in the sea.

Crustacean you can catch
in the sea or rivers.

Crustacean you can catch
in rivers.

Crustacean you can catch

Crustacean you can catch
in rivers.

Shellfish you can only
catch in the sea. Can
catch in a fish trap.

Shellfish you can catch in
rivers. Can catch in a
fish trap.

Shellfish you can only
catch in the sea. Can
catch in a fish trap.

Elusive big game fish
found only upstream in
rivers.

Elusive big game fish
found only downstream in
rivers.

Elusive big game fish
found only in the sea.
Swims at a regal pace,
like it owns the sea!

Elusive big game fish
found only on
mountaintops.

Elusive big game fish
found only near
waterfalls. A legend
among legendary fish.

Elusive big game fish
found only near the shore
on your farm. A legend
among legendary fish.

Big game fish that lives
in the depths. Scary-
looking but tasty!

Big game fish found only
in the sea. Will die if it
stops swimming.

Big game fish found only
in ponds. Beautiful
coloring.

Elusive big game fish
found only in cold
regions. A small but
splendid shark.

Elusive big game 
found only upstream in
rivers.

Elusive big game
found only midstream in
rivers.

Elusive big game fish
found only downstream in
rivers. Can even go on

Elusive big game
found only in the sea.

A popular kind of cicada.
Easily found anywhere from
early morning to midday.

A small, round-bodied kind
of cicada easily found
anywhere during daylight
hours.

Despite the name, this
cicada is most active
during the hottest part of
the day in the summer.

A popular kind of cicada.
Easily found anywhere from
early morning to late
evening. Chirps actively.

A cicada with a distinct
chirp. People describe the
sound it makes in many
different ways.

Cicada that gets its name
from the screeching sound
of its chirp. Small-bodied
with big wings.

Has a constant, monotonous
chattering chirp.
Often found in shrubs.

A giant cicada that can
grow to more than 10cm in
length. Has a small chirp
for its size.

A large cicada that often
stays in one spot from
morning through evening.
Makes a keening chirp.

Cicada that usually chirps
when light is dim at dusk
and dawn. Makes a
melancholy sound.

A giant among cicadas.
Most often head chirping
from sunrise to midday.

A large beetle with a
prominent horn that makes
it very popular with
people of all ages.

Giant beetle with three
long horns. Along with the
Hercules Beetle, ranks as
the world's largest.

Named after an ancient god
of the underworld.
Covered in fur.

A hefty beetle covered in
velvety yellowish hair.
Horn is fairly small
relative to its body size.

A beetle famous and
popular for being the
largest of all.

A rare beetle that is the
same species as the
Hercules beetle, but with
white and yellow colors.

A large and attractive
beetle with a white,
yellow or sometimes
golden-colored shell.

The most beautiful beetle
because it has the whitest
shell of all.

Famous for its huge
mandibles. More popular
with adults than kids.
The larger the better!

A large pincer beetle with
a large pair of mandibles.
Tend to be skittish.

A beetle that comes
in many different colors
and patterns.

A large beetle that
shimmers like a rainbow.
The world's most beautiful
beetle.

The world's largest stag
beetle. Famous for its
long mandibles.

A much-loved dragonfly
whose appearance is the
first sign that fall has
arrived.

A dragonfly found in ponds
and swamps near the coast.
Very nimble and will flit
away when approached.

Much bigger than a red
dragonfly, and very
territorial in its
behavior.

A dragonfly you often see
around. Widely popular for
its black and white
coloration.

A fast-flying dragonfly.
Seen on sunny days and
sometimes on rainy days.

A mid-sized dragonfly with
glittering azure body and
wings. Likes slow-moving
rivers.

Skinny yellow dragonfly.
Darts as quick as the wind
and voraciously eats
anything it catches.

Dragonfly with a face like
an ogre! But it's
actually very gentle.

Dragonfly with a wider
abdomen than other
dragonflies. An agile
flyer.

The underside of this
dragonfly's abdomen is
silver-colored. Extremely
territorial.

Much bigger than an aegis
dragonfly. Despite its
intimidating size and look
it is not aggressive.

The largest living
dragonfly.

Well-known and much-loved
firefly that heralds the
coming of fall with its
flickering light.

A firefly that was popular
with the ancient nobility
and still is today.

Firefly with different
wing patterns depending on
where it lives. Often
found in forests.

Firefly with a light that
flickers less than others.
Found in the bushes on
chilly or rainy days.

Small firefly of Southern
Island. Males fly near the
ground flickering once per
second to attract females.

Inconspicuous firefly with
dark wide stripes.
Stealthily active during
the day, too.

A firefly small enough to
fit on the tip of your
little finger. Flies in
the forest and treetops.

Small firefly with dull
colors. Its larvae are
ferocious and deliver a
painful bite.

The adults don't glow very
much, but this firefly's
whole body glows during
the pupal stage.

A kind of firefly that
does not glow and lives in
warm climates.

Named for its main color,
but also has red marks on
its shoulders.

Firefly that flickers a
lot as soon as it emerges.
Active during the day, but
no one has ever found one.

A firefly that loves the
summer even more than
other fireflies.

Green frog that gets
excited by the sound of
rain and always pops up
when it rains.

A frog about 10cm long
with rough skin that
secretes a poisonous
liquid.

A frog that lives near
mountain forests and makes
a chirruping croak.

A forest-dwelling frog.
Red eyes and green body
give it an appealing look.

A tree frog that grows
quite large. Tends to
sneak into houses, so you
see them around.
The king of frogs.

The world's largest frog,
it inhabits tropical
jungles. Can grow up to
80cm in size.

A butterfly as small as a
petal, with black spots on
yellow. Frequently seen in
fields of flowers.

Butterfly with yellow
wings that seem to shine
bright as sunlight.
Quick to fly away.

Butterfly with white
stripes and bullseyes on
light-brown wings.
Flutters near the ground.

You can find this
butterfly anywhere. Has a
varied diet, from flower
nectar to tree sap.

A purple butterfly not
good at walking. It takes
flight even to move just
a short distance.

A beautiful butterfly with
velvet-like wings that
glimmer as it flies.

A petal-like butterfly
with a black on white
pattern. Frequently found
in fields of flowers.

Striking, speckled black
and white butterfly.
An elegant flier.

The underside of this
butterfly's wings have
fine brown and white
zigzags. Found in fall.

A garden white that has
pretty orange-black
mottling at the tip of
white wings.

A shimmering white
butterfly with large and
beautiful wings. A jewel
in the sky when it flies.

This butterfly is widely
found in forests. The
male's wing tops have a
lovely indigo shimmer.

A large and popular
butterfly. Often seen
anywhere from cities to
mountains to rivers.

A large and beautiful
butterfly. You may spot
its dark purple wings
fluttering in the forest.

A butterfly cloaked in a
purple gleam. Said to have
a mesmerizing power over
people's minds.

A large butterfly with
kaleidoscopic wings of
green, yellow, blue, black
and other colors.

A garden white adorned
with white, yellow,
orange, red, black
and other colors.

A locust found most
often in swampy areas.
Recognizable for its
thin, tapering head.

A popular locust of the
mountains that gets along
with other locusts, even
carrying them on its back.
The king of locusts.

A locust that can adapt to
all sorts of environments
and seasons. Boasts a
speckled pattern.

A cricket notable for its
very loud chirp. Appears
day and night but prefers
dark places or night.

A giant cricket with a
glossy head. So large it
has been called the "demon
cricket."

A cricket with a
distinctive face. Lives in
all kinds of places, city
or country.

A kind of ground-dwelling
cricket. Its mole-like
front legs make it a good
digger.

A cricket with long
antennae. Males make a
chirp like a bell by
rubbing their wings.

A grasshopper found from
spring through fall.
Adaptable to various
environments.

Grasshopper that likes to
sit on grass and leaves.
Its large size makes it
the king of grasshoppers.

A type of katydid that is
light brown all over. You
can hear it chirping on
warm nights.

A small katydid with
blackish brown sides and
wings. Has a trilling
chirp.

A honey-making bee that
stores up honey in its
hive. Has a long
association with humans.

A bee very often used in
beekeeping.

A rare bee from the
Southern Island.

The world's largest
honeybee, found only in
the highest mountains.

The most popular ladybug,
with seven black spots
on a red body.

A colorful ladybug that
displays various mottled
patterns. Often found in
fields.

A rare ladybug with six
yellow spots on a black
back.

Very small ladybug whose
forewings are all-yellow,
but with a pair of black
spots on its white belly.

A ladybug distinguished by
12 white spots on its
yellowish brown forewings.

A large ladybug with a
distinctive black and
white pattern and glossy,
beautiful body.
